rComments: The poster who says she doesn't curve doesn't know what a curve means. Every exam Dr. Ruben showed us a significantly curved grade breakdown. And if I got an A with a final percentage in the 80's- there's a curve, by definition. The class is hard no doubt. Dr. Ruben is clear, has high expectations that make you work hard, but you learn A LOT!

Just like any other Biol upper-div, if you watch the webcast and take very detailed notes you'll be absolutely fine. Ruben expects you to remember every detail she went over in class and she proves it because her tests contain questions that she might have covered in only one slide.
Says she will curve but does not in the end...

I disagree with the commenter regarding her lectures.   Staying in line with text is MUCH better than lecturers who are completely random then test on it.   She is energetic, enthusiastic, clear, and helpful.  Hard exams but study hard and you'll get an A.  OH was extremely helpful.  They felt like conversations, not inquiries.  Awesome teacher!

Attending her lectures are pointless.  She just reads from her slides which are word for word copied from the book.  I would recommend just watching the webcast because (rarely) she might mention something that was not covered in the book.  You will have to read and study everyday. Never went to section, OH were not helpfull.

She was fair, but she wasn't that approachable. When I ask her for help, she would reply with a very condescending tone as if my question was stupid. I know many others felt the same way. She also read straight from her slides during lecture.

Giulia was great professor for human phys. The tests were tough but fair, she gave sample questions before the first midterm so you knew what the format would be like. She also gave a topic list for each exam and only rarely did anything show up on a test that wasn't on the list.

Hands down best professor in the department. She is a blessing. I learn so much from her and she teaches in a motherly style. She will rarely give you a 90% raw score on the final paper, but it's realistic and reflects how harsh the scientific community is, but is curved accordingly. Take each module hw seriously. MAN IS GIULIA FREAKIN HOT OR WHAT

She's super clear about what she wants in the writing, and you learn a LOT about scientific writing. TA was a tough grader, but it definitely made a difference for the final paper. Giulia is super passionate about her work, and it shows! This class was definitely my favorite.

lecture style was nice. It was frustrating preparing for her tests bc of ambiguous questions w the expectation of specific answers, TAs were super harsh on your grading. can be helpful if you see her but she's really picky about administrative stuff which I find unnecessary. She can also give attitude at times when approached about grade concerns

This was the best class I took at UCSC. It was extremely interesting and Guilia was amazing at going through the info in way to make sure everyone understands. Tests were incredibly difficult so be prepared to study a lot (studying is not so bad when the information you are reading about is awesome!)

Dr. Ruben was absolutely amazing. Specifically in terms of clarity in writing and lectures. I have rarely met someone so clear with their thoughts on paper. I learned more about writing from Dr. Ruben's guidance during this lab class than I did from just about any english teacher. Deserves and demands the utmost respect.

Giulia teaches at a great pace, has informative lectures, and actually helps you learn and understand the material rather than just making you do straight memorization. Totally lecture based, If it weren't for the online reading quizzes I would not have used the textbook. This class requires a good amount of effort but is totally worth it.

Best instructor I've had so far! Giulia has a great ability to explain topics in an organized and easy to understand manner. She is very open to questions and is extremely helpful. She takes great pride In her students understanding and doesn't rush through material. TAs are extremely helpful must attend class to do well.

Great genetics professor. Took this class previously with prof. Dalbey and had to drop (or fail). The difference in the level/detail of instruction between these two is like night and day. I knew from the first lecture that prof Rubin's teaching style is more conducive to how most students' learn. She was also VERY personable!
